problems.title: Check Valid Credit Card Number (Luhn Algorithm)
problems.description:
Given a credit card number, validate it using Luhn algorithm:
1. Starting from right, double every second digit
2. If doubled digit > 9, subtract 9
3. Sum all digits
4. If sum % 10 == 0, card is valid

Print "Valid" or "Invalid".

Input Format:
Single string of digits (credit card number).

Output Format:
Print "Valid" or "Invalid".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4532015112830366

Sample Output
Valid

Sample Input
4532015112830365

Sample Output
Invalid

Explanation:
Implement Luhn algorithm with careful handling of digit doubling and validation using conditional logic.
hintsList: Process digits from right to left. For every second digit, double it. If result > 9, subtract 9. Sum all digits and check if divisible by 10.
